title: Unable to access server due to firewall

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
i have just spent the past 30+ mins trying to get into a game because my firewall was not allowing me to access the servers. my internet is working fine and i kept attempting to reconnect, i re logged to make sure and the same message came up over and over again. i did not see the loading screen and after the game i looked in my match history and it counted as a loss for me (link provided.) i don't think it was my internet as i was trying to find solutions to this problem using the internet however i'm not a tech whizz so please forgive me if i overlooked something. i played 2 or 3 games a few hours earlier and they both had no issues but this really frustrated me and i would just like to know if this issue happens again how i can solve it for future reference. 
if you need any info, just tell me and ill let you know asap
P.S. it was a normal game and my internet did not play up during the time i was attempting to reconnect

replies.body: please i still have this issue and its really frustrating me as i was looking forward to playing bard :(

Have you tried the ol' [changing your DNS trick](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4)? Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. If it doesn't, then we can at least eliminate it as a DNS problem.
OMG that solved my problem, dude thank you so much, you also solved my steam issue with that! seriously thanks heaps man really grateful

No problem man. Honestly it's the fault of your ISP for making your default DNS so crummy.

Remember this if you ever get a new connection. Happy gaming!
I have the same problem its LOLs fault they need to fix it I have made no changes to my firewall

also i had my dad help me because i'm not amazing with the computers but my dad is and he opened cmd and started a traceroute to see where the problem is. (attached) and he told me how the connection times out going to your servers. weather this is true or not i'm not sure but it's the only thing i can go off
